sorular.soru: Which vehicles have green number plates?
cevaplar: Vehicles that belong to vehicle dealerships.
Vehicles that are subject to the old-timer scheme.
sorular.dogruCevap: Vehicles that belong to vehicle dealerships.

feedback.metin: Green number plates are used by companies in the vehicle trade, such as dealerships. Unlike regular number plates, a merchant’s number plate can be used on different vehicles, for example during test drives.

sorular.soru: Should you turn right here?
cevaplar: Yes. You must turn right here.
No. Only if you are transporting dangerous substances.
No. You do not have to turn right here.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You do not have to turn right here.

feedback.metin: The sign only indicates a detour route and not a compulsory direction of travel. You are not required to follow it.

sorular.soru: When should a fully electric vehicle be approved for the first time?

feedback.metin: New vehicles that run on petrol, alcohol or an electric motor must undergo an APK for the first time 4 years after the first admission date. Then twice every two years and then every year.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to continue driving when the light turns yellow and you are able to stop safely?

feedback.metin: When the light turns from green to yellow, you must stop. Only when you cannot stop safely, you are allowed to drive on.

sorular.soru: What can you get imposed if you are preparing to drive a vehicle under the influence of alcohol?
cevaplar: Nothing. After all, you are not a driver if you are not driving yet.

feedback.metin: If you are about to drive under the influence of alcohol, or any other substance that affects your driving skills, you may be banned from driving. A driving ban is a ban on driving a vehicle (including a bicycle!) for a certain number of hours. This is imposed to prevent someone from driving (further) under the influence of alcohol. A driving licence suspension can only be imposed if you have actually driven a motor vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive at 90 km/h here?

feedback.metin: All roads outside built-up areas have a speed limit of 80 km/h, with the exception of autowegen and motorways or roads where a lower speed limit is indicated by signs. On autowegen and motorways only, you may drive a car with a trailer at 90 km/h, unless a lower speed is indicated by signs.

sorular.soru: Who should you give way to when executing a special manoeuvre?

feedback.metin: When you execute a special manoeuvre, you must give way to all road users, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: What do priority triangles mean?
cevaplar: Give right of way to all drivers on the intersecting road.
Give right of way to all traffic on the intersecting road.
Give right of way to all road users on the intersecting road.
sorular.dogruCevap: Give right of way to all drivers on the intersecting road.

feedback.metin: Priority triangles are road markings painted on the road surface. These road surface markings indicate a directive – drivers must give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road – and are usually accompanied by priority road signs.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the lorry on the right?

feedback.metin: Drivers on the right-hand side of the block marking are allowed to overtake drivers on the left-hand side.

sorular.soru: Can you use rear fog lights when visibility due to snowfall is less than 40 metres?

feedback.metin: You may turn on the rear fog light if visibility due to fog or snowfall is less than 50 metres. This is not allowed when it is raining.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: If circumstances force you to merge between a military convoy, this is allowed. However, because you are not part of the military convoy, you will still be subject to the normal traffic rules.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to send a short message?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a disabled parking space where you can only park if you have a disabled parking permit. Furthermore, the supplementary sign indicates that this parking space is reserved for one specific vehicle, with the registration number stated on this sign. Your number plate does not match the one on the sign. Stopping to send a message falls under parking. This is not allowed here with this vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake at a speed of 100 km/h on this road?

feedback.metin: The green line in the middle indicates that this is an autoweg with a speed limit of 100 km/h. You can overtake here because the double line is not solid but broken.

sorular.soru: There are no other drivers approaching. Should you stop here?

feedback.metin: The B-7 sign indicates that you are approaching an intersecting road where you must give right of way to all drivers on the intersecting road. The sign requires all drivers to stop even if there are no drivers approaching on the intersecting road.

sorular.soru: How long does it take on average for the liver to break down two standard glasses of alcohol?
cevaplar: Between half an hour and 1 hour.

feedback.metin: Alcohol is broken down in the body by the liver. This happens within 1 to 1.5 hours per standard glass of alcohol. For two glasses, this takes 2 to 3 hours.

sorular.soru: Should you move to the right here?

feedback.metin: The vehicle on the acceleration lane has yet to get in lane. If you move to the right here, you get this vehicle in trouble. That is why you should keep driving here until the vehicle gets in lane.

sorular.soru: What traffic behaviour is expected of you here?
cevaplar: Maintain the same speed and make way if possible.
Briefly tap on your brake to scare the tailgater.
Drive faster to create more distance.
sorular.dogruCevap: Maintain the same speed and make way if possible.

feedback.metin: Tailgating is prohibited. If someone is tailgating you, stay calm. Keep driving at the same speed and go, if possible, to the right. Do not use your brake to warn or startle the tailgater. If there is an accident, you will be prosecuted for a crime.

sorular.soru: Who has right of way when merging?
cevaplar: The driver who wants to enter the main carriageway.
The driver who is already driving on the main carriageway.
sorular.dogruCevap: The driver who is already driving on the main carriageway.

feedback.metin: Merging is a special manoeuvre. The merging driver must give way to all traffic on the main carriageway and must never force his way in.

sorular.soru: What does this matrix sign mean?

feedback.metin: A red cross above the lane means the lane is closed. This is also indicated in advance with a white slanted arrow, which indicates that the lane must be cleared. Continuing to drive in a lane with a red cross above it is forbidden and punishable with a substantial fine.

sorular.soru: Does this sign mean you have to give way?

feedback.metin: The J-24 sign warns of crossing cyclists, snorfietsen and moped riders and drivers of speed pedelecs. The bottom sign indicates that they can cross from both left and right. The sign says nothing about how the right of way is arranged. Please pay attention to the priority signs. If these are missing, give right of way to drivers coming from the right.

sorular.soru: How can you check whether the road is slippery after snowfall or sleet?
cevaplar: By making a quick steering manoeuvre.

feedback.metin: Braking briefly and carefully is a good way to check whether the road surface is slippery and adjust your speed accordingly. Before doing this, use the mirrors to ensure there is no traffic behind you. Keep in mind that it may be more slippery in other areas.

sorular.soru: Is this heavy load properly placed in the trailer?
cevaplar: No, the load should be placed at the very front of the trailer.
Yes, this is the best position for the load.
No, the load should be placed at the very back of the trailer.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, this is the best position for the load.

feedback.metin: The load is placed properly in this situation. If you are transporting a heavier load in a trailer, it is important that the load is placed as low as possible in the trailer. It should also be placed as far above the axle as possible to ensure that the drawbar load is not too high or too low.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a partially illegible vehicle registration document?

feedback.metin: You may only drive a vehicle if you have an undamaged, original, valid, and clearly legible vehicle registration document in your possession.

sorular.soru: Is it mandatory to have an emergency hammer in the car?

feedback.metin: Because modern cars are equipped with a variety of electronic features, there is a higher chance that doors and windows may be impossible to open should the vehicle become submerged in water. Having an emergency hammer in every vehicle is therefore recommended. However, this is not mandatory.

sorular.soru: Where can you look up the correct tyre pressure for your vehicle?

feedback.metin: The correct tyre pressure depends on the type of tyre and type of vehicle. This information is included in the instruction booklet (not on the tyre itself or the rim) and on a sticker inside the fuel filler flap or on the inside of the door. Air pump machines found at petrol stations usually have a list of common vehicle models and their corresponding tyre pressure.

sorular.soru: What do you show by means of your parking disc?
cevaplar: Until what time you expect to park at that spot.
That you are parked and therefore not loading and unloading.
At which time you started parking.
sorular.dogruCevap: At which time you started parking.

feedback.metin: In parking disc areas you must place a parking disc visibly behind your windscreen while parking next to a blue line. On the parking disc, you set the time you started parking.

sorular.soru: What does this dashboard light indicate?

feedback.metin: This dashboard light indicates that you are driving with your full-beam headlights on.

sorular.soru: Does the use of a navigation system affect driving skills?
cevaplar: Yes, this is always a distraction.
Only if you set it up while driving.
No, this can only help you.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, this is always a distraction.

feedback.metin: Using a navigation device offers many benefits, such as advising you of the best route to take and helping reduce fuel consumption. However, using these devices requires you to divide your attention among multiple tasks, such as checking the screen and listening to voice prompts, which distracts you from both using the device and following the advised route.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to wait here for a passenger?

feedback.metin: The E-7 sign means you can load or unload goods before immediately continuing your journey. Waiting for passengers is classed as parking and is therefore prohibited here.

sorular.soru: How does a vehicle seat with an Isofix system attach to a car?
cevaplar: Via specialised belts used to secure the seat.
A special click system attaches directly to the bodywork.
Via existing seat belts in the vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: A special click system attaches directly to the bodywork.

feedback.metin: Isofix is a standardised system for attaching vehicle seats to a vehicle’s bodywork. All modern passenger cars are equipped with this system, which allows you to attach child seats into mounting brackets in the vehicle. If a vehicle is not equipped with an Isofix system, the existing seat belts can be used to secure a vehicle seat.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park or stop to drop off or pick up passengers within 5 metres of a crossing, as this may hinder cyclists or pedestrians.

sorular.soru: During driving this light starts flashing. What should you do?
cevaplar: Drive on and tell your garage at the next service appointment.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
Drive on to the garage and have it checked.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.

feedback.metin: This light indicates a problem with the engine management. If this light comes on (but does not blink), you can still drive on to the garage and have the car checked. But as soon as the light starts flashing, you should stop and call the breakdown service. This could mean an acute problem with the engine; driving on could cause additional damage.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here at 9:00 PM?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a motorway where a sign indicates a speed limit of 100 km/h applies.

sorular.soru: Is it wise to switch on your hazard lights when you encounter a traffic jam?

feedback.metin: When approaching a traffic jam, warn traffic behind you by turning on the hazard lights. As soon as the vehicle behind you turns on their hazard lights, you may switch off your own. Approach traffic jams with adjusted speed, check the mirrors regularly, and take into account motorcyclists who may drive through the traffic jam.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the bus?
cevaplar: No. This is only mandatory in built-up areas.
No. This is not mandatory if the bus is at a lay-by.
Yes. This is mandatory both inside and outside built-up areas.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. This is only mandatory in built-up areas.

feedback.metin: The rule that says you must give way to buses indicating that they want to leave a bus stop only applies in built-up areas. You are driving outside a built-up area, so the bus must give way to you.

sorular.soru: The car and trailer have a combined length of 9.5 metres. Is this vehicle combination allowed on this road?

feedback.metin: The C-17 sign means: closed to vehicles and vehicle combinations which, including load, are longer than indicated on the sign. In this case, the sign indicates 10 metres. Values indicated on these signs vary.

sorular.soru: The warning triangle is placed 30 metres beyond the car. Have you placed it correctly here?

feedback.metin: If you are standing still on the carriageway with a breakdown and pose a potential danger to others, you must switch on the hazard lights, and/or place a warning triangle. This warning triangle should be placed in the direction of the traffic most likely to be hindered or endangered. In this case, the warning triangle is on placed on the wrong side of the car and is of little use here.

sorular.soru: Which lighting is required when driving through a tunnel?

feedback.metin: You must switch on dipped headlights well before entering a tunnel. Using dipped headlights not only aids your visibility, it also makes your vehicle more visible to other drivers.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you are overtaken?

feedback.metin: If you are overtaken, you may not increase your speed. You obstruct those who overtake you and endanger other road users. This is prohibited. Reducing speed is also not necessary. Keep your speed the same; this way, you are also best predictable for other road users.

sorular.soru: Is it sensible to make room for the motorcyclist to overtake between traffic jams?

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to drive between cars in slow-moving and stationary traffic jams if the difference in speed does not exceed 10 km/h and if it is done carefully. This is only allowed between the two left lanes. Therefore it is sensible to make room for the motorcyclist as it promotes the traffic flow.

sorular.soru: How far may a load protrude behind a passenger car?
cevaplar: Loads may not protrude from behind the passenger car.
A maximum of 3 metres behind the rear axle.

feedback.metin: Both divisible and indivisible loads may protrude a maximum of 1 metre from the rear of a passenger car.

sorular.soru: What are you allowed to do here?

feedback.metin: If there is a yellow broken line on the kerb, parking is prohibited. Only picking up or dropping off passengers and loading and unloading goods is allowed here. Waiting for someone is not included, as this is parking.

sorular.soru: Can you drive without a right wing mirror?

feedback.metin: Passenger cars must have two wing mirrors (one on the left and one on the right) and an rearview mirror. These must be properly attached and the mirror glass must not be broken or damaged.
